result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffrey A Cleveland

records.addlTxt:
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

2:39 PM Defendant Jeffrey A Cleveland in court.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Jeffrey A Cleveland.  Attorney Jedidiah Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Court calls case.
Atty Dodge states appearances.

Matter is set for a waived preliminary hearing.
Atty Bergner does not have a form filled out but has gone over the form with his client.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
BY THE COURT: On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Bond continued.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on November 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Do not possess/consume illegal drugs or  controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.

1:18 PM Defendant Jeffrey A Cleveland appeared by video, in custody from Wood County Jail.  Attorney (Atty) Maxwell Bergner in court for Jeffrey A Cleveland.  Assistant District Attorney ADA) Andrew Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin. Cases 21CM355 and 22CF124.
ADA Mutchler requests the warrants be quashed.
Atty Bergner informs the court the reason for the defendant missing court.
BY THE COURT: Warrants are quashed in both cases.
Bonds is set in 21CM355 and 22CF124.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.
for 05-23-2022 hearing
Preliminary Hearing set for 05/16/22 - attempted, not known (not at this address)

3:10 PM Defendant Jeffrey A Cleveland not in court.  Attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Jeffrey A Cleveland. 

Defendant fails to appear.
Court questions Atty Bergner as to where his client is.
Atty Bergner states that he was in contact with his client and he is working today.
ADA Pfeil is requesting a warrant with a $500 cash alternative.

BY THE COURT:
Warrant with $500 cash alternative.
Preliminary hearing on May 23, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Matter sched for prelim on 5/23/22 @ 3:00 PM,

Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued. 

Court questions the defendant. 
Defendant is aware of the conditions of his bond.
